result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Charles G. Bailey
Current: 1828 S. Hastings Way #136, Eau Claire, WI 54701 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: 3973 Nicholas Dr #1, Menomonie, WI 54751

(Cases 20CF74, 22CM911 are called at 11:47 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Charles Bailey appears in custody via video conference from the Jail Law Intern David Carlson supervised by Attorney Sonia Anderson. ADA Monica Fallon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant in 20CF74 is executed. Defense waives reading of the complaints in 20CF74, 22CM911. Defendant updates address and phone number. Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived in 20CF74. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 11/21/2022 at 2:15 PM. 
Hearing in both cases: 12/08/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
